Reviews.Title: “great room for the price,”
Reviews.Author: christopher r Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the room was large in size. down fall it is a ways off the strip so traveling back and forth to the strip is time consuming. a little noise being on the ground floor with housekeeping going by at 8 am most of the day. i should have picked a 2nd or 3rd floor room to avoid this.

Reviews.Title: “Stuck in the middle of nowhere!”
Reviews.Author: CLMDinger
Reviews.Content: If you don't have your own transportation you are STUCK! No shuttle service to the strip or airport and if you can get a cab it's $30 to the airport. No customary taxi's waiting in line, you have to call a service and your wait could be more than an hour. We ended up walking to Sam's town (two miles) to get a cab and insure that we would not miss our plane. The rooms are in buildings away from the casino and are a long walk. Although it appears they make an attempt to keep the front of the property maintained, the buildings themselves are in poor need of paint and refurbishing. The food is mediocre, I was the only customer in the steakhouse at 5:30 in the afternoon. The casino is small and only had two open Blackjack tables. Never will I stay there again, what I saved in room rates didn't come close to covering my taxi charges.

Reviews.Title: “I'll Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: Jacqui1288
Reviews.Content: We opted to pay a few dollars more and get the "Suite". It's a 2 bedroom suite with sleeping accomodations for up to 6 people. The accomodations were nice and roomy with televisions in both rooms. There are a few restaraunts located on the premisses. The Coffee Shop has a wide selection of foods to choose from and is reasonable. The casino is small but friendly. The staff is attentive and friendly. We will be staying here again when we go back in February 2012 for our grandson's birthday!

Reviews.Title: “ECONOMICAL STAY & BREAKFASTS ARE GREAT”
Reviews.Author: Jim L
Reviews.Content: OK, let's be honest. if U can get a clean, comfortable and reasonably well located hotel which gives U a double room mini suite with two Queen size beds in it for less than $40, I'd call that a real bargain. Where they treat U right, the service is friendly and the food is good, where there is plenty of parking and it's security patroled day & night. Then why not stay there? They even have a Casino and if you are good, maybe Lady Luck will smile on you a bit, but don't count on it. We are not at all cheap, but we don't believe in wasting money unnecessarily either. AND THAT'S MY POINT. This is a bargain hotel but it has everything you want, including 2 restaurants. It is most definately not the "RITZ" but then neither are the prices. If economy is your concern, no need to look any further. This place will fit your wallet. And guess what? There are NO BEDBUGS either. This was our second stay here and I'm sure it won't be the last. We recommend it to the budget conscious.

Reviews.Title: “There are better options”
Reviews.Author: westie2
Reviews.Content: It nearest competitors (Sam’s Town, Eastside Cannery and Boulder Station) are all of better quality and competitively priced. We stayed a few nights and, though our room was classified as a suite, it was of average size broken into a small sitting room and an equally small bedroom. There may have been a renovation it was constructed, but we found the furniture and carpeting to be worn. Our room faced the parking lot nearest the casino and was quite noisy on the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Back to Arizona Charlie's for the 2nd year.”
Reviews.Author: ChippyChop55
Reviews.Content: Another good trip to Arizona Charlie's Boulder. All my experiences with the staff were good and just like last year the room value was exceptional. Hard to beat a suite for the price of a room. Restaurants will do but not super great, lots of other choices near by. Casino was still too smokey for me but so was everywhere else I went in Vegas. Overall, good value, clean rooms and just before I left to come home I hit a jackpot in the Casino that covered my entire vacation. It doesn't get any better than that in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Room very nice, Casino needs a face lift”
Reviews.Author: Darren B
Reviews.Content: OK I spent 5 nights at Arizona Charlies and just got back Tuesday evening. I must say the rooms are very nice for the price. In fact they are very large almost like junior suites and they give you 2 seperate bedrooms. We had 4 adults so it was very nice. It even had a sofa that one of the adults liked sleeping on. They have a basic but nice pool area and a hot tub next to the pool that was relaxing. The casino is smaller by Vegas standards and very smokey. For some reason they really must cator to smokers cause every slot and video poker machine had a smoker at it. Because of the casinos smaller size the ventilation system cant handle it and the smokey haze is all over the place. The buffet was small but very cheap like 5 bucks for breakfast. One nice alternative is that Arizona Charlies is only a couple of blocks from Boulder Station and Sams Town Casinos. They are much larger and much nicer. They have huge buffets that are the same price as Charies but way nicer. So simple sleep at Charlies cause it is nice. Then spend the rest of the time at the other places a block or 2 down the street. The folks that work at Charlies are very nice and work very hard. Unless you are looking for a palace like Mandalay Bay you will be happy at Charlies. We booked the room through Hotwire and it was only like 28 bucks a night cant beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for the buck!”
Reviews.Author: KayGee21
Reviews.Content: No frills property. Inexpensive. No "resort charges" (watch out, they can add more than 12$ to your daily room rate...Look up Cheapo Vegas for more info). Decent secure accomodation (24 hour a day "human" patrols + all the surveillance cameras you can imagine from a casino). Quiet "hotel" area away from the gaming, specially the rooms and suites facing the courtyard. We've been coming here for 2 to 3 week stays over the last 13 years and have never been disappointed. If you have a complaint, approach the front desk in a direct and respectful manner and "problems", whatever they are, from a soiled carpet to WiFi not working and more, and the hotel staff will be more than happy to solve it.

Reviews.Title: “Full service hotel on Boulder Highway”
Reviews.Author: ggabi
Reviews.Content: First of all: this hotel, and Boulder Highway itself, are off the Strip. About 4-5 miles away! If you want to stay on the Strip, this hotel is not for you! Very nice property, several motel-style buildings, outdoor pool, full-size casino, restaurants, free parking, usually at very good prices. They say that slots on Boulder highway pay more than ones on the Strip or Downtown LV...

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it”
Reviews.Author: alpha03
Reviews.Content: I could go on and on about the poor service when I checked in. The old and dirty room. The tv with very poor reception etc.etc. So many better selections in this fine town. avoid it at all costs !

Reviews.Title: “Value to be had here”
Reviews.Author: asiatraveller5000
Reviews.Content: We booked for one night but stayed 2.Would have stayed longer but the joint was booked out.We paid 34$ and $ 39 for a suite room.Look it is a 2.5/3 star place, brown carpet.Its comfortable and super value.Its quiet. Its about 15 mins drive to the strip so yu need a car really. Would not hesitate to stay again for the price. If it was 45$ or more I would not stay.Some of the strip hotels or closer can be had for that as long as it not the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: 5CC5
Reviews.Content: Not glamorous by any means, but cheap and clean. I prefer staying on the strip, but it's not extremely far if you have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel & Good Rate”
Reviews.Author: tyballast
Reviews.Content: I found the location a bit inconvenient since its farther away from the tourist part of Las Vegas. However, the price was great and the room was large and clean. The bathroom is old and needs to be remodeled.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, near highway”
Reviews.Author: solewalker
Reviews.Content: Arizona Charlie's Boulder Casino Hotel is located some ways off the strip, which made it very cheap (less than 30 USD per night for a room with two doubles). Although it was off the strip, there were sufficient amenities around the hotel, so you won't be left wanting for options if you need a midnight snack. Also, it was less than one mile off the freeway, and the lack of traffic made it incredibly easy if you wanted to take day trips to places like Death Valley.

Reviews.Title: “TOTAL TOTAL VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: benebyers
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 6 weeks. about 5 miles from the strip, so easy to get to if that is your peference to play. Rooms are first class and so so cheap. The casino is small but ultra friendly staff. Cannot fault their enthusiasm and try to cater to your needs. Plenty of good food outlets and the food in the Yukon Grill is to die for. Plenty of good shopping malls within a three mile radius. Having a rental car would be adventagous but there is a good local bus service. If you like playing bingo then this is the place. 24 hour bingo and the bingo staff are incredible. Not just a game but an adventure. Love this place to bits

Reviews.Title: “What a hassle! Might as well have been Motel 6.”
Reviews.Author: Valowski
Reviews.Content: I called earlier in the week to reserve a room because I was unable to do so through their website. The representatvie I spoke with explained that the systems were down and to call in about 2 hours. I did so and spoke to another representative. She explained that the system was still down but could go ahead a reserve a room... why couldn't the other rep I know not. I booked a room for my mother and grandmother for 2 nights. I decided once in Vegas that I would stay their too. The front desk could not give me the same price and told me to call the reservation line. The supervisor I spoke to argued with me that their system was not down when I called originally and would not honor the rate. I even gave her the reservation I already had and the reps name I spoke to. The front desk called them back for me, which she should have done in the first place. They did nothing. The front desk woman gave me a small break with what she could. At check out, the cost was more than I was quoted and the notes left said she was giving me a discount but never mentioned what the discount was. Upon returning home, I have multiple charges on my card that they are unable to explain and offered to credit me back 3/4 of the additional charges but not all of it. UGH!! You might as well stay at Motel 6 because thats what the room looked like.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic place”
Reviews.Author: mitchellthetexan
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel at twice the price. Yes, it is off the strip, but a ten to fifteen minute drive and you are on the strip or freemont st. The room was huge and the grounds were perfectly maintained. Security was evident all the time. Ask for a courtyard view, you wont be dissapointed. We stayed 5 nights and had no problems at all. We are already planning a second stay. Some reviews mention the 7-11 behind the building. I went daily and had no problems at all. Also there is a wal mart just down the street for those forgotten things. I have nothing but good things to say about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is Perfect...”
Reviews.Author: COMom4
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel is perfect for a young family. The rooms aren't spectacular, but they are sufficient. They have plenty of space, a nice pool (which is too cold in March), a great jacuzzi, friendly staff, and really pretty grounds. It's safe, security cruising around ALL day and night. The rooms are quite clean. The casino is fun for the grown ups. I liked not being on the strip, I just have no need to be in the middle of things. It's a close enough drive to get to the strip, 5-10 minutes tops. I will stay here again. My only issue may have been simply that there are prostitutes walking around by the entry way into the hotel (which is anywhere in Vegas), and there was a man digging through the trash every morning looking for cans. But the Can Guy was innocent enough and he had a purpose-- I am GLAD that someone is recycling the cans! If he makes his money doing it, at least it's getting done. It was just strange to see because we don't have that sort of thing happen in our town.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I've Ever Been To”
Reviews.Author: tuber247
Reviews.Content: We arrived this past weekend to the hotel. The front desk employee "upgraded" us to a suite instead of the basic room. The first thing we noticed was the strong stench of what seemed like chewing tobacco in our non-smoking room. The couch and floor had stains on them. Only one light fixture in the rooms were able to be turned on with a light switch. One of the outlets were damaged. The bathroom was only big enough for a bathtub and a toilet and the floor was covered in what we hoped was only water. After examining the light fixture above i noticed maggots and moths crawling around in the light-bulb. Upon leaving we encountered a car with a group of kids smoking marijuana right in the parking lot. This is definitely not a place I would recommend for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Off the Beaten Path”
Reviews.Author: PeteG2
Reviews.Content: This place was OK as an accommodation; nothing special. The buffets were good, and very reasonable. Not the place to stay if you don't have your own transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: simpsonas
Reviews.Content: In town to visit before daughter and family moved to Germany. This is a great place to stay with young children Mr granddaughter was 5 months old. We requested and were given a crib. We had a two room suie was great. Also the fact you did not have to walk through the casino with children was a real plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Dealers!”
Reviews.Author: PlayerJ777
Reviews.Content: Loved the dealers on the grave yard shift! They are so much fun! This is just a relaxed and fun place to enjoy yourself. You save your money and then you have some to spend on the tables. Thanks for such a fun time!

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: Misanthrope79
Reviews.Content: If you go in expecting brand new top of the line furniture or a bellboy to carry your luggage, then you're in for a disapointment. But if you go in with an open mind and knowing what a 2 star hotel looks like or should look like then there will be no disapointments. The hotel has large rooms. The pool is pretty small but clean and you will have it to yourself most of the time. There's 2 security guards walking around the property 24 hours a day. There's a good size casino with 5 restaurant options including a daily breakfast, lunch and dinner buffet. The hotel is about a 10 minute drive to downtown and about a 15 minute drive to the strip. The room was clean everyday when we got back. My wife and I were impressed with the service and room for the price and we will definetely be staying here next time around. When my wife and I travel the only thing we use our room for is to sleep and store luggage the rest of the time we are out and exploring. If this sounds like you, this hotel will not disapoint you.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience both times!!”
Reviews.Author: newmommyCa
Reviews.Content: Unbelieve prices and good accomadations! I have family in Vegas whom my parents visit monthly. Arizona Charlie's boulder is their hotel of choice and I see why. On the 2 trips we have been able to take with them, we have really enjoyed our stay! The price is unbeatable ($25 a night!!) I was pleasently shocked on our first stay that the second bed was in the living area, it was nice to have our privacy. My husband is 6'2 and over 200 lbs, his feet hung off the full size bed, and we had t cuddle some, but we can't complain too much because the price was so amazing! On both trips we took the room has been a little dirty, well, not dirty, just had some cobwebs on the ceiling and black shoe prints on the ceiling as well (weird that both rooms had the show prints.) I recommend this hotel to anyone! Very spacious and accomadating and the price is amazing!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel and casino”
Reviews.Author: markwilson1957
Reviews.Content: If you think this place is not a great value, you are just a hater, and probably always complain .....We stayed here this past weekend, and everything was perfect......NO ROACHES anywhere.....The staff was very friendly and couldnt have been more of what we wanted them to be like....The rooms were very clean---big----and the price was right....$50 Friday and Saturday for a 2 room suite.... The buffet was also priced right and the food was very good...We will for sure try to come back here next time when we go to Vegas and also tell our friends the same.....

Reviews.Title: “Roach Heaven”
Reviews.Author: SteveKPhoenix
Reviews.Content: Check in - paid for a suite - No bellman to help with luggage, after carrying in the luggage found 2 dead roaches. We reloaded the car and checked out - they did not refund the charge for the room.

Reviews.Title: “It was quiet and pleasant, especially for the price.”
Reviews.Author: reseeone
Reviews.Content: I stayed her with my spouse for a weekend getaway in Vegas. It was great everything was in order, no foul play anywhere as stated in other reviews. I also found it more pleasing that the casino folk and the people actually staying in the hotel we're no where near each other. It was a quiet and pleasant stay. We had a blast and will stay there again and again. Especially for that price. oh the only thing is they have a deposit of $35, which you get back upon check out, but it was unexpected for me-just caught me off guard, seeing as how it was prepaid.

Reviews.Title: “Good Room Cheap Price”
Reviews.Author: gpuffenbarger
Reviews.Content: Everyyhing went Aok . Hotel was quite clean and at a good price

Reviews.Title: “There are better places to stay on a budget”
Reviews.Author: KateSW
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located 5 miles east of the strip on Boulder highway- the rooms are tired but really big and cheap. Almost no soundproofing so you hear every step overhead.Awful tv in the rooms and no in room coffee service and cheap ice buckets made me feel like I was in a cheap roadside motel. The food in the upstairs restaurant was cheap and filling with their gamblers card and the casino is running a rebate on your losses up to 100 bucks so you can gamble for a longer time- but no need to stay here. Do expect lots of smoke in the casino so do not wear your fanciest duds.

Reviews.Title: “Not fancy bit very reasonable prices.”
Reviews.Author: hagar2935
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Casino is not on the strip.... a fair drive from it, but much quieter. Parking was a bit confusing, so the best place is in the garage behind the casino, where you can take the elevator to the main floor. The hotel desk is best reached, however, from the valet driveway. When we arrived, there was no sign of a parking valet, however. The place is more of a motel than hotel, with multiple buildings and floors. The room was VERY inexpenive (only $34.99 less a $10 discount for a Nevada resident) and was actually a two room "suite". The room was clean but somewhat old, but for the price, it was well worth it. If you are on a budget, this is a good choice. The buffet on Monday was 2 for 1 and the food was fairly decent. Not bad for a couple at $10.17!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Replynow2me
Reviews.Content: As we wanted to stay away from the high weekendrates in Vegas we booked this hotel for 3 nights (fri-mo), paying 98euro in total through Expedia. Location: Though on the Boulder Strip it's location is ok really. It's a 15 minute drive from the Strip if you take Flamingo. Close by are Sam's Town and Boulder Station. There's a new Walmart Supercenter across from Sam's Town. Hotel: The hotel has several buildings. We think they are in good condition. We had a (big) corner room facing the (cold) pool. We were pleasantly surprised as this room turned out the a two room, two bed 'suite'. Though there's not a lot of furniture in the rooms..there's a sofa and two tv's. The bathroom is ok, but the fan is really(i mean REALLY) loud (goes on when you turn on the light). The carpet was brand new and we noticed they were replacing carpets in other buildings to. Icemachines are not located on every floor so prepare to hike... Pool : Small, but has a hot tub as well. Plenty of good seats and beds, both in shade and sun. Towels are provided, but we found the box empty most of the time. A call to housekeeping was enough to fill the box again though. Parking: Though quite a pain at night, during the day there's enough parking availabe. At night just use the free valet service if you don't want to wait for a free spot. Casino: We didn't gamble here, but found the casino a bit cramped and smokey. Registration is in the Casino. The other reception they used to have south of the hotel towers is closed now. Buffet: We were pleasantly surprised. We had breakfast here and the quality of the food is good. They cook eggs to order and have fresh donuts. Price was less than 4 bucks with Players Card which is really cheap. If you are looking for a cheap, clean room this is a good place. if you are in vegas as a tourist and you have just a few days here....you better choose a hotel closer to the Strip. I suggest Terrible's which is within walking distance of the Bally's/Paris corner of the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location and Great Price”
Reviews.Author: suzyq9363
Reviews.Content: We drove from Wisconsin to Las Vegas. The hotel was easy to find, right off the highway. We booked our room online about a month before we arrived. For $40 a night you can't beat the price, especially for a King Suite Room. We returned each night to find our room was cleaned, beds made and a seashell fan made out of the roll of toilet paper (that was a nice touch). There are two Arizona Charlies in Las Vegas, and while this one did not have shuttle service (The one on Decatur does). We ate at both and ours (on Boulder) had much better food.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: snugglebunnies
Reviews.Content: This was a quick stay of two nights on our way home from California. I had to visit a LV emergency room and needed to rest after receiving medication, but we ended up in Las Vegas several hours ahead of our original plan. I called Arizona Charlies to ask if we could check in early--this was just after 9 a.m. They got us a room right away. It was large, very clean, and non-smoking. yea! The next morning, after heading to an early breakfast in the Wild West Buffet inside, the lady behind the counter was very kind in giving myself and my two children the cheaper rate...if you held a casino gambling card. They have no children's buffet rate, and I was happy for the kind discount. The buffet had a great choice and was good food. We waddled out contentedly.:) We were gone just under an hour, but upon returning to our room, it had been made up and cleaned---all before 9. That was nice! The only problem was checking in and out. The air quality in the casino itself is terrible. I had to breathe through my shirt while at the hotel registration desk. When I mentioned it to the lady behind the counter, she agreed, stating, "I have to sit in it all day, and my lungs are terrible." I booked through Expedia---having used them for years. We paid $35 a night and I feel it was a great deal for the money. They no longer offer the shuttle, but we had our car with us anyway. :)

Reviews.Title: “Problems with this hotel, which is really a motel and casino.”
Reviews.Author: OlderEd
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really a multi-stored motel behind the casino. Management is very oriented to casino customers and does not seem to care much about overnight customers. First, there is no indication of where registration is located or where to park to register. Finally, valet parking man indicated to park on red curb area (fire lane location?) in the "Thru Lane" in front of casino. There were parking spots in front of motel rooms, but these were mostly occupied by local gamblers so sometimes you are forced to park far away in garage. No indication spaces near motel were reserved for room guest. The room was humblely furnished, had a big living room and a nice size bedroom. However, the bath room smelled awful from mildew/mold. Nearest ice mache did not work. Had warning that all items in room were inventoried so do not steal anything. Also, be sure to secure main door with lock device when in room. Prices of food and room were cheap, but I would not stay there again. There are other better place for about same money in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Why Bother?”
Reviews.Author: Phillygwm
Reviews.Content: I'd gambled at Arizona Charlie's Boulder previously but never stayed at the hotel until my most recent trip. Friends had traveled with their RV and this happened to be close to the RV park where they stayed. Trust me, this hotel is as close to the end of the line as I want to be, The room was large but really threadbare and had cigarette burns all over (despite being a non-smoking room.) It's not a convenient trek from the room to the casino. The rooms are comparable to a Motel 6, only larger. There is also no Internet access. The casino staff was very friendly but the place seemed a lot smokier than I remembered. I couldn't play for long periods because of thoke, so I often went elsewhere. Others have complained about the neighborhood; it obviously isn't high class but I encountered no problems. I did have a car, though, and didn't rely on shuttles or public transit. If everything else is booked or if you're on the thinnest of shoestring budgets, this place is OK, but really, there are nicer places to stay for only a few bucks more which are quite a bit nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Stinks!!!”
Reviews.Author: TheAirmeister
Reviews.Content: Could not breathe because of stinking heavy cigarette smoke. Owners should install some sort of clean air machine or something. Would have stayed longer if the smoke hadn't been so bad

Reviews.Title: “Great for a basic accomadation for a low price.”
Reviews.Author: NoelsCat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night. We are a family of 4 adults, one tween and a toddler. This afforded us reasonable and convenient accomadations for a very reasonable price. The rooms are large -- consist of a sitting area and a seperate bedroom and bath with a very large closet. It is great in that way because the rooms afford a lot of privacy. The rooms are also convenient for coming and going because they are outside rooms with free parking. This is both good and bad -- you also have to walk outside to get to other parts of the motel/hotel -- such as the casino, pool, dining, etc. The food at the buffet (as well as the service) was really good. This would be a great place if you are coming and going -- or adults who care little about hotel features and more about Vegas attractions. You would definately want a car since the strip is about 8 to 10 minutes away -- and it is an easy drive. For families looking for more inclusive atmosphere -- just a mile away is Sam's Town -- a better location with kids and just a little more money.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain for a suite”
Reviews.Author: jeeperforever
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a very busy weekend 7/7/07. Booked the suite since we would have our 6 year old granddaughter with us. Surprised at how big the suite was. Had a small couch, coffee table, end table, TV in a cabinet and a full size bed in the main room and a King in the second room with a bathroom. Nice to be able to close the door between the rooms. It was clean and comfortable. Sink is outside of the small toilet, tub area. Entering from the parking tower to the casino we were confused as to were the check in desk was so we asked an employee on the casino floor for directions. With a smile she had us follow her all the way through the casino to the check in desk. The staff at check in was also very polite and helpful. Good value in the buffet and cafe with friendly staff also. I would only stay here if you have your own car. It's a bit far from the strip or downtown to take a taxi which might get expensive. Two night stay on Sat/Sun. was only $109.00 booking weeks in advance on the hotel web site. We plan to try the Decatur location even though it cost more just to see if we like it better but will stay at the Boulder location again also. I was worried that it would be a dump because of the low price but it was fine. Yes we have stayed at nicer places and some not so nice and paid a lot more.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough!”
Reviews.Author: morrira
Reviews.Content: Room was "worn", but as expected for $30 a night. Had to walk "aways" to the casino, and the parking filled up quick in the evening. Had issue in the casino as I wanted to take advantage of a highly publicized promotion "Re-imburse the first $100 of your losses on the first day". I had signed up for the A.C.E. Rewards card on-line when I made my hotel reservations two months ago, and I was informed that I was "ineligible" for the $100 re-imbursement as I was not considered a "new customer". I had just received my membership card that day, upon my arrival. I couldn't get anyway to help me or budge, so they've lost me as a return customer and I'm telling everyone I know and about my experience.

Reviews.Title: “All that and a bag of chips”
Reviews.Author: fishinful
Reviews.Content: Arizona Charlies is a small casino on Boulder highway. We ( a family of 5 with two teens) stayed 4 nights here for a BMX race at Southpoint . The location, off the 215 at flamingo, was easy enough to access for all of Las Vegas. Access to a vehicle is a must, esp. in the summer. The temp. was triple digit teens the whole time we we there. A few large Casinos are nearby but everything is a drive. The Rooms- They are as the other reviews state; nothing fancy.We rented two King Double suites. Two rooms,Two beds, T.V.'s couch,table and ample storage for clothes. We kept Three bicycles in one suite with room to spare. The corner suite was a little bigger. And the sink in the room was funky. I tried to be critical of everything knowing that I would write a review, and really could'nt find anything wrong. No mystery stains, comfy beds and sanitary toilets. Tokeing housekeeping got fresh towels. We paid rack rates , thur arrival and Mon. departure and it came to $400 total for both rooms! Such a deal. If you're a family traveling on a budget, this is a very good value for your hard earned cash. The Casino- Plenty of Penny and Nickle machines. Lots of video poker and keno. Most are older (1 or 2 years) It was never crowded, and finding a machine was pretty easy. A small but decent Race and sports book. It closed early though, so if you like to play Harness, go to Sams Town down the street. Bingo can be had 24-7. We played a few times. Games called rather quick Payouts were good. Table games were small and a seat could be found even at peak times. Only two crap tables. Lounge act was rather silly but better than the drone of slots. No live Keno. Not too smokey. Lots of locals. The food- Basic eats. The Buffet was inexpensive, Hot food, Fresh and plenty of it. We ate at least one of our meals of the day there and everyone walked away full, even the picky teens. Same for the 24 hr.Sourdough Cafe. Try their Strawberry shortcake. If you eat the whole thing and get sick, it's your fault. The Staff- I did'nt find a single Grouch. Everyone was happy and helpful. A rare thing indeed. Overall- Because the Hotel is separate from the Casino, One must walk outside to and fro. This creates the problem of walking around at all hours with large sums of cash in hand. the staff has provided Armed Security Guards on bicycles roaming the property. I saw no less than three in one morning while throwing all the equipment in the truck. I felt safe at all times, and that's not an easy thing for me. Because the rates are so reasonable, There were quite a few traveling workers here.They work long hours and just want to sleep when they get back. Our rooms were on the ground level, and I did not hear unneccesary noise from abouve, although the kids did in their room. There are valid reasons not to stay here, But for us, it fit well and We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Scary! Run Away!”
Reviews.Author: meowers1
Reviews.Content: The only reason we stayed here was: We had a large group, and a lot of hotels were booked due to NASCAR weekend or totally over priced. This place is scary! There are scary locals creepy around the casino. Hold onto your purses! Seen some gang bangers lurking around the hotel. Thank god for the security guards riding their bikes around...but they were on the weird side as well. Maid service came in and made our beds even though we had the "do not disturb sign" on the door. I wasn't very happy about this considering I thought I made my bed just fine and I don't want strangers in my room. A guy staying down the hall said when he got out of the shower there were 2 security guards standing in his room. He asked them what they wanted and they said they thought they smelled smoke then walked out.??Weird! We spent soooo much money taking taxies to the strip from Arizona Charlies. This is when we were lucky to have a taxi come by. NO TAXIES COME BY AZC!!!! You have to walk WAY up the road to another casino, soooo girls wear comfortable shoes! Hell hole! Don't do it!

Reviews.Title: “Not a good location or safe place”
Reviews.Author: blondetogray
Reviews.Content: Well we just needed a place to stay as we were visiting family in the area. We had no intrest in the casino so the fact that it was not close to our room was ok. The eating cafe was ok, nothing fancy. Smoke is the smell of everything in the casino areas. The room was ok, clean enough for the price. The area is not safe. There was a fight in the parking lot one night but security was there to break it up fast. The noise was high as many that use this hotel are workers in the area. Police activity is very high in this area as well as drunks, bums, and pimps looking for activity. If you stay in your room after 10 and pile stuff in front of the door to feel safe this is your place to stay. The staff was ok but you have to ask for everything you want such as hair dryers and coffee pots. I would guess many walk off the grounds. Don't be fooled by the good price. This is a beware place. It is erie and I would not go there again if it was the last place on earth. I shook in my pants every night. If you are looking for a family hotel try the chain hotels, much better areas and even the higher price is worth it. Better safe then sorry. Unhappy Camper

Reviews.Title: “Not Great, Not Terrible”
Reviews.Author: on-the-journey
Reviews.Content: The good news is that it was a two room suite, near a very nice pool area and just across the driveway from the casino. The room was tired, could use some upgrading. If you aren't paying too much, it isn't terrible for a few nights.

Reviews.Title: “Your typical LV low class hotel”
Reviews.Author: bjaysfan21
Reviews.Content: Booked and prepaid my reservations via Expedia. From the website, I thought the hotel was part of the casino. It's not. It is a seperate building and looks exactly like the other cheap motels along the Boulder Highway. Check in was inside the casino, by the gift shop. Because I prepaid the room, I didn't want to put down a credit card. Instead I was forced to pay $35. in case I "lifted something from the room". The next morning, I had to get my deposit back. By the time they made up the room, I would have been long gone. Don't understand this policy at all. Both check-in and check-out personnel were indifferent. Both tried to sign me up for their "player's club" card. The rooms were suppose to be "suites", bywhich, you had to seperate rooms. Although spacious, they were both small and sparse. The bathroom was tiny and difficult to use. Both Expedia and the Casino should clearly state that this is a motel and not a hotel by any means of the word. Also, their check-in policy should be made clear at the time of booking. Would not stay at this location again, only because there are other motels on the Boulder Highway just like it.

Reviews.Title: “not good but not bad either”
Reviews.Author: E777
Reviews.Content: There were LOTS of ANTS on sink. We have to kill them all before brush our teeth. The bed sheets smells a bit, you can hear voices from other rooms, the parking lot is ALWAYS FULL, some people take 2 spaces for one car, the security was there but didn't say anything. However, the front desk was friendly, the housekeeping too. It's not too far fron the strips, the price is reasonable. We would probably stay there again but will request a room without ants =)

Reviews.Title: “Friendly people, great deals”
Reviews.Author: Shelby66
Reviews.Content: We've stayed downtown and played at Arizona Charlie's for several years so this time we decided to stay there. We recieved a coupon deal that resulted in us paying $ 20 per night for four nights. Since we played there our comp earnings covered all of our food as well (not a high roller). The staff, from dealers to the check-in lady to slot personnel were the friendliest I have seen in over 20 years of visiting Vegas. They smiled and said hello whether I did or not! Meals at the buffet are terrific and most reasonable. They are making a huge effort to make the landscaping and grounds look very sharp....and it shows. The grounds are clean and neat. The only odd thing I encountered was the room layout. There's lots of room in the 2-room suites, but the layout makes it look rather sparse. It really needs more furniture and larger TV's...but these were minor drawbacks to us since all we do in the room is sleep. This oddity was more than overcome by all the other pluses. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: florida_snowboarder
Reviews.Content: Just returned from another great trip to Vegas. I had stayed at the other Arizona Charlie's location on Decatur a couple of years back and it was great, so I figured I couldn't go wrong with the Boulder location. I am a member of their Ultimate Rewards club (the players club for both Arizona Charlie's locations as well as the Stratosphere) and responded to a direct offer I had received from them which gave me an upgraded suite for the price of a standard room. Check-in was very rapid and I was especially appreciative of the check-in clerk, Elenora. I was having a problem with my debit card - it turned out the company had put a temporary block on it for suspicion of identity theft! Fortunately I got it all straightened out, and Elenora swiped that card about 10 different times over the course of an hour without even frowning. That takes alot of patience - you don't often see much of that in the customer service industry anymore. Thanks again, Elenora! The property differs slightly from the Decatur location as all of the corridors and buildings are outside vs. being enclosed. The decor of the rooms is a little more Mediterranean vs. southwestern, as the Decatur location is. The suite (I believe it was a Standard King Suite) was very spacious, two televisions, extra cold air conditioner, very good water pressure, and lots of closet space. The casino was great as always and the Sourdough Cafe was teriffic. Be sure to check out the $2.99 Steak and Egg special, it's the best you'll ever had and has won several awards in Las Vegas magazines. Overall, a teriffic stay and I'd recommend it to everyone. Remember, you won't get the glitz and glamour of the Strip in some of these off-strip casino hotels, but it's been proven that places like these are far superior in customer service and higher casino payouts. The room prices and friendly employees can't be beat. Give it a try!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: KapnKrunch
Reviews.Content: Following is a list of overall impressions: 1) The facade is under construction, making it difficult to get around the front of the hotel/casino. Trucks and workers often impeded clientele traffic. 2) We had a heck of a time finding the hotel check in desk. Only one sign hinted at its location, then we finally had to ask the valet guy. 3) Overall, the exterior is filthy. The sidewalks are ugly with air conditioning, gum and grime stains. Some portions of the exterior were repainted, with overspray on the walkways (no tarps used), The walls and air conditioning units were grimy. 4) We booked a "deluxe" suite with a king bed. There's one big, stark room with a tiny TV in the amoir. Grimy old carpet and dingy walls greeted us. The "ball/hook" door lock was broken off. The bedroom had another tiny TV/amoir, with a fair mattress, and the sink (single) RIGHT NEXT to the bed. The pillows were small, and the linens were stingy (only two bath, hand and wash towels). 5) We called the front desk to get some additional pillows around 6PM, and no one ever came. When we called again to inquire, they said "housekeeping" was hard to reach. No one ever called back, and we never got our pillows. 6) The bathroom fan did not work. Use your imagination after an evening out eating. 7) Service at the Sourdough cafe was abysmally slow. Even after the restaurant manager visited our table to "check" on us, our meals took another 10 minutes to arrive. Bottom line, this place is the WORST hotel I've visited in over 10 years (Motel 6 does a better job), and I travel extensively. We felt unsafe walking the grounds gazing upon what looked like gang bangers. Avoid this place at all cost.

Reviews.Title: “AZ Charlies Boulder we will be back Next Year”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is only our 2nd annual trip to Las Vegas (Mom, Aunt and I). First hotel we stayed at, was AWFUL. So yes Arizona Charlies Boulder was a welcome step up. We had a nice deluxe room which was plenty big enough for us. We loved that the sink and mirror are separate from the shower. Since 3 women trying to get ready at once can be a scary thing. We had an excellent spot, parked right next to elevator and went right up to our room. Great view of the Pool which was nice the one day we got a chance to get in. We ate at the Buffet and the Sourdough Cafe, must say my preference was the Cafe, not the Buffet. Our first impression was not the best because the check in lady had NO Personality but every staff member during our stay after was very friendly, helpful and had a smile for us. You definitely need a car if you are staying here and wanting to go to the Strip or anywhere else. The only downside we did discover was the carpet was stained in some places but the room and bathroom itself looked clean and maintained. We are already planning our 3rd trip and Arizona Charlie's Boulder (East) will definitely be on our list to stay at. For the price and the location, it is a great deal... After reading all the reviews here, I was abit afraid but for the price for 3 of us, it couldn't be beat and thought OK lets do it. I am glad I didn't let the mixed reviews detour me from booking a room and staying here. Also, lastly, the air conditioner in our room worked great which is a big must have.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great, But not THAT bad”
Reviews.Author: izzyblizzy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here only because it was the only room we could find when my BF had to attend a convention on last minute notice. Almost all the rooms were sold out in Las Vegas for the days of the convention. The few that were available were going for $400 plus, so this seemed like a good deal for $39 (through hotwire) a night during a busy convention week. We stayed Tuesday-Friday. LOCATION This is on Boulder Highway, far off the strip, and they do not have shuttle service to the strip. We had a car, so location wasn't that big of deal, but don't stay here unless you have a car. Boulder Station and Sam's Town are on either side (long walk or short drive). CHECK-IN We checked in about 11:30 AM. The clerk first told us they were completely booked, and all we could get was a double room, and no rooms were ready yet. We slipped her a $20 and she found a King/double smoking suite that was ready for check-in. Note that the front of the hotel is under construction, so you need to go through the casino entrance and check in there. ROOM The room was barely adequate, but can't really complain for the price we got. First, the good. It was spacious. It was close to the pool, but looked out on the parking lot and the 7-11 next door, but was pretty quiet with little road noise. Fairly clean, with a stain here and there on the carpet. Also the windows open up, which is nice for fresh air and a breeze. It had two rooms. A large front room with a double bed w/end table, sofa w/end table, coffee table, armoire with drawers, and small tv (reception was clear for us, but only 8 channels, no HBO, etc. you could order movies.) The second room was a bit tight with a King bed, a corner unit with another small tv, and a sink stand. It also had a large walk-in closet. I found the bed to be fairly hard, and the pillows were very uncomfortable. The bathroom was tiny with a toilet, and a tub/shower combo. It was dingy and old with some mildew in the tile caulking. Shower pressure was ok, but not great. Shampoo and lotion for products. Be aware that the rooms have no amenities except for an alarm clock. There is no hairdryer, iron, ironing board (although i guess you can request them, although they don't make this known, but i did see one housekeeper removing one from a room), coffee maker, fridge or microwave. There is only dial-up internet access, with a 75 cent per connection fee. Also, there was only one ice maker that I could find and it was at the opposite end of the complex, there was no ice maker near the pop machine at our end. THE GROUNDS The units all surround and open up to a courtyard. There is landscaping and paths to the casino, with a courtyard sitting area toward the casino end of the courtyard, a fountain in the middle area, and a pool area w/hot tub at the far end. There is always security around on bikes, so the grounds seemed safe. We used the pool twice and it was very uncrowded considering the place was full. They have lots of deck chairs that you can use in the sun or in a shaded area they have. The hot tub wasn't very hot, but was ok. (I noticed the reviewer below said there was no pool, but I think she must have been in the wrong area of the courtyard, because there most definitely is a pool). CASINO We were in the unit farthest away from the Casino, but I didn't find the walk through the courtyard that long to get there; I have walked farther to get to the casino in large strip hotels. The casino was fairly small by las vegas standards. But gaming is cheap and it was never super crowded. Video Poker makes up the majority of the machines. There aren't that many tables, but I rarely saw them all full. We won some, and were up a couple hundred on our second day there, but managed to lose most of our gambling money by the end. Cocktail service was good and friendly. Lots of locals seemed to game here, and they were all friendly and fun. RESTAURANTS There is the Wild West Buffet, The Sourdough Cafe, The Yukon Grille Steakhouse, and a deli for sandwiches and fast-food type stuff. The prices for food are extremely reasonable, and friendly service. We ate at the Sourdough Cafe for breakfast several times and a couple other meals. The ham and egg special for $2.79 is huge. They also had a steak and egg special for $2.99, the steak was a little tough, but had good flavor. My bf's favorite was the chicken fried steak and mashed potatoes he had one night for $4.99. We also tried the Yukon Grille Steakhouse one night, it was reasonable, but underwhelming. I had the small filet medium rare, which was overcooked and tasteless, and my bf had prime rib, which he didn't enjoy at all (I have a feeling you could do the prime rib in the studio cafe for $7.99 and would get the same thing). Each entree was about $18. With a bottle of wine, salads, two entrees, and a shared dessert, the total was only $75, but I would rather spend more for really good steak. Overall, I wouldn't stay here again unless circumstances required it. But if you are doing las vegas on a tight budget, it is not a bad value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Run to Another Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gameday95
Reviews.Content: We stayed with my daughter's soccer team and it was awful from the beginning. We got there late Friday night and when we checked we assumed we were getting a non smoking room but when we went to our room , it reeked of smoke and there was an ashtray and matches in the room. The TV was from the 1980's and had only a few channels and ghost image on one of the channel's. Try watching Jay Leno with a ghost image of him in the TV. I called to change room and the from desk stated that no room were available until the next day. I stated to the from desk that I wanted a non smoking room and the from assured me they would be room available. I called three different times , the next day and they told me to call later. That the room were not availAble yet. I went downstairs, by elevator which has no up button , you can only press the button to down The front desk person got a non smoking room for me. I walked back to the room with the smell of fertilizer and view of dead grass. The suite's bathroom was the size of a closet and i had to dry off in the bathtub for more room. Need I say more. Save your money and go somewhere else.

HotelInfo.Name: Arizona Charlie's Boulder Casino Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 4575 Boulder Highway, Las Vegas, NV 89121
